stem: A 32-year-old female patient developed lower abdominal pain and watery brown vaginal discharge, 1 day following the placement of an Intra-Uterine Device (IUD). The most likely cause for this is
disc:
Cramping abdominal pain and vaginal bleeding are the most common side effects during the first week of inserting an IUD.

Most patients have some degree of bleeding or spotting after inserting an IUD and they should be counseled that the bleeding is not usually more than the menstrual bleeding and it may last longer. However, in patients who have significantly more bleeding, care should be taken to exclude partial expulsion, perforation, or lacerations.

Cramping abdominal pains are common in most patients and they may be mild to moderate in intensity.
